title: Scott Adams, the Dilbert Cartoonist, Passes Away
summary: Scott Adams was a famous cartoonist who created the comic strip Dilbert. He died at age 68 from cancer. His ex-wife announced his death on his podcast. Dilbert started in 1989 and was in many newspapers worldwide. It was about an engineer in a funny workplace. Later, some newspapers stopped publishing Dilbert because Adams said things that people thought were racist. He apologized and said he was exaggerating. Former President Donald Trump said nice things about him after he died. Adams also wrote self-help books and was a hypnotist. He had prostate cancer that spread, and he knew he might not get better. In a message, he asked people to be kind and useful.

background_read: Scott Adams was a well-known American cartoonist famous for Dilbert, a comic that made fun of office life. He started it in 1989, and it became popular in many countries. Later, he got into trouble for saying offensive things about black people, which led to newspapers dropping his comic. He also wrote books to help people improve themselves and practiced hypnosis. He died from cancer after a long illness.
